result.execSummary:
The defendant Derreck L. Tilley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court Costs paid in full with cash bond previously posted.
Huber Privileges and Good Time credit granted.

records.addlTxt: to Poster - Ck No 010256

Case Called @ 9:02 AM: Defendant Derreck L. Tilley in court, appearing via telephone, with attorney William M Lennon, appearing in person.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution recited by DA with argued terms on penalty.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance with Def.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of personal appearance.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Elements of offense explained w/PTAC elements.   Plea colloquy entertained. Def states he does not believe there are sufficient facts for a jury to reach a guilty finding.  Def declines to go forward with a trial.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend INFO as to Ct 1 to Misd Level POT w/PTAC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) - Plea:  NC  Plea Ct 2 as charged w/PTAC:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Factual basis to accept pleas - Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty Lennon.  No Statement offered by Defendant.  The Court:  Finds it appropriate to accept State's recommendation and imposes as to Ct 1: 60 days WCJ and Ct 2:  30 days WCJ - concurrent terms,  Report 8/1/14 @ 8:00 pm Huber, GT and TS Credit of 5 days; Court Costs with DNA Surcharge as to each charge - bond to be applied and more than likely sufficient to cover costs in full. If not, 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given and will be forwarded today with SASE to Def - counsel instructs him to return it within 1 week.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case Called @ 11:16 AM: Attorney William M Lennon in court.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Lennon:  Believes matter has been resolved and he speaks as to his pending Motion to Withdraw - requests Court withdraw his Motion to Withdraw as counsel.  Conferred with Def in detail this morning prior to going of record.  Def has agreed to accept State's offer for 2 Misd offenses.  Def was made aware that he would have to return to WI one more time for sentencing.  Atty Lennon suggests sentencing on day of JT.  The Court:  Schedules P/S hearing - matter will have to be resolved prior to releasing the trial date scheduled for 7/17/14.  P/S Scheduled with authorization for Def to appear via telephone.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case Called @ 3:36 PM: Attorney William M. Lennon in court, appearing via telephonically.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lennon will be requesting a Summer jury trial date due to Defendant enrollment in college.  Based upon requrest FPTC/JT Scheduled.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
State's
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss: Insufficient Complaint
Status conference on April 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Derreck L. Tilley in court with attorney William M Lennon.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Motion to Dismiss filed just prior to going of record today.  Counsel request Motion Hrg be scheduled.  Atty Lennon suggests combined scheduled for Pre-Lim Hrg and Motion Hrg.  The Court:  As to Motion to Dismiss rules as follows upon review of the Complaint, motion has validity to it but does not believe that the Complaint lacks probable cause.  Motion for Dismissal is denied - Complaint does sufficiently establish probable cause as to dominion and control.  Atty Lennon wishes to waive Pre-Lim Hrg in its entirety.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.   INFO Filed.  INFO Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  Counsel to conduct an informal PTC prior to return for STC.  STC - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  If resolution that is reached short of felony resolution, Court will allow Defendant's appearance via telephone with Def's waiver of personal appearance.  If STC only, phone appearance authorized.  Any felony level resolution will require appearance in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
William Lennon
Initial appearance on February 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:26 p.m. Defendant Derreck L. Tilley in court with attorney Bryan Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting lower cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
